page.title: 09Four Famous People
page.content: James Brindley(1716_1772),Raphael Hollinshed(d.1580),Charles F.Tunnicliffe(1901_1979)and William Whiston(1838_1915) all have strong links with Sutton.Brindley,designer and canal engineer served his apprenticeship in Sutton. Hollinshed, the Elizabethan chronicler that Shakespear used as a source for some of his historical dramas,is connected with the area.Tunnicliffe,the world famous bird and country life artist and writer was born in Langley,lived later in Sutton and attended St. James' school.An annual art competition is held for children of primary school age,funded by the Tunnicliffe and Wonnacott family.Whiston became owner of the print works in Langley and helped in providing the school and chapel and some housing in Langley.
